subhed: Elected representatives in Saint-Pierre-et-Miquelon, the only French overseas territory in the North Atlantic, home to 6,000 people, aim to deepen ties with their major partner, Canada, amid growing geopolitical tensions with the US.

title: Epstein affair: Former Norwegian prime minister Thorbjørn Jagland under investigation for corruption
subhed: The Norwegian police have announced the opening of an investigation into Thorbjørn Jagland, who led the Labour government from 1996 to 1997, on suspicion of 'aggravated corruption' in connection with his past ties to the American sex offender.

title: Secondhand market booms, challenging luxury industry
subhed: The market for pre-owned luxury goods has been growing by 10% each year, but specialized resale platforms have struggled to find a profitable business model.

title: Lore Baudrit, captain of France's Olympic women's hockey team: 'We train like pros, but don't get paid'
subhed: The forward, who has played 250 times for the national team, was set to take part in the first Olympic tournament of her career starting Thursday. Like most of her teammates, she has to juggle life as a top-level athlete with a day job.

title: Ukraine's 'grandfathers' go to war
subhed: The Ukrainian army has an average age of 45, significantly older than European standards. The draft has targeted men between the ages of 25 and 60, which contrasts with recruitment practices typically seen in Western countries.
